H0.text: Developing a theory about the plant is the best way to verify that it is a new species when a scientist finds a plant and states that it is a new species.

H1.text: Comparing the plant to other plants is the best way to verify that it is a new species after a scientist finds a plant and declares it a new species.

H2.text: Observing the plant with a microscope is the best way to verify that it is a new species for a scientist who finds a plant and states that it is a new species.

H3.text: Determining the best growing conditions for the plant is the best way to verify that it is a new species for a scientist who finds a plant and states that it is a new species.

A4.text: natural classification. Classificatory groups are defined by certain characters, called 'defining' characters; in a natural group, the members of the group resemble one another for non-defining characters as well as for the defining character.
